item.title: Amber add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You own everything that happened to you. Tell your stories. If people wanted you to write warmly about them, they should have behaved better." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Amber add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "After a good dinner one can forgive anybody, even one's own relations." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Amber add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Human speech is like a cracked kettle on which we tap crude rhythms for bears to dance to, while we long to make music that will melt the stars." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Amber add a quote by George Saunders
item.description: "Don't be afraid to be confused. Try to remain permanently confused. Anything is possible. Stay open, forever, so open it hurts, and then open up some more, until the day you die, world without end, amen." -- George Saunders

item.title: Amber add a quote by Betty Smith
item.description: "Look at everything always as though you were seeing it either for the first or last time: Thus is your time on earth filled with glory." -- Betty Smith

item.title: Amber add a quote by Arthur C. Clarke
item.description: "Two possibilities exist: either we are alone in the Universe or we are not. Both are equally terrifying." -- Arthur C. Clarke

item.title: Amber add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "There comes a time when one must take a position that is neither safe, nor politic, nor popular, but he must take it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Amber add a quote by Abigail Adams
item.description: "If particular care and attention is not paid to the ladies, we are determined to foment a rebellion, and will not hold ourselves bound by any laws in which we have no voice or representation." -- Abigail Adams

item.title: Amber add a quote by John Grisham
item.description: "In life, finding a voice is speaking and living the truth. Each of you is an original. Each of you has a distinctive voice. When you find it, your story will be told. You will be heard." -- John Grisham

item.title: Amber add a quote by Nelson Mandela
item.description: "When a man is denied the right to live the life he believes in, he has no choice but to become an outlaw." -- Nelson Mandela

item.title: Amber add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?" -- Edward Albee

item.title: Amber add a quote by Louis Adamic
item.description: "My grandfather always said that living is like licking honey off a thorn." -- Louis Adamic

item.title: Amber add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Life has no meaning. Each of us has meaning and we bring it to life. It is a waste to be asking the question when you are the answer." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Amber add a quote by Vincent Van Gogh
item.description: "Be clearly aware of the stars and infinity on high. Then life seems almost enchanted after all." -- Vincent Van Gogh

item.title: Amber add a quote by Marguerite Duras
item.description: "Our mothers always remain the strangest, craziest people we've ever met." -- Marguerite Duras

item.title: Amber add a quote by Charles Darwin
item.description: "If I had my life to live over again, I would have made a rule to read some poetry and listen to some music at least once every week." -- Charles Darwin

item.title: Amber add a quote by Cynthia Ozick
item.description: "We often take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude." -- Cynthia Ozick

item.title: Amber add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "Do your thing and don't care if they like it." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Amber add a quote by Hergé
item.description: "Hooray! Hooray! The end of the world has been postponed! " -- Hergé

item.title: Amber add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "She had studied the universe all her life, but had overlooked its clearest message: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Amber add a quote by Orhan Pamuk
item.description: "I read a book one day and my whole life was changed." -- Orhan Pamuk

item.title: Amber add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Amber add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Amber add a quote by Katharine Graham
item.description: "The longer I live, the more I observe that carrying around anger is the most debilitating to the person who bears it." -- Katharine Graham

item.title: Amber add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Amber add a quote by William Strunk Jr.
item.description: "Omit needless words." -- William Strunk Jr.

item.title: Amber add a quote by H.P. Lovecraft
item.description: "Pleasure to me is wonder—the unexplored, the unexpected, the thing that is hidden and the changeless thing that lurks behind superficial mutability." -- H.P. Lovecraft

item.title: Amber add a quote by Richard Price
item.description: "You don't write about the horrors of war. No. You write about a kid's burnt socks lying in the road." -- Richard Price

item.title: Amber add a quote by Kathleen Winsor
item.description: "Charm is the ability to make someone else think that both of you are pretty wonderful." -- Kathleen Winsor

item.title: Amber add a quote by Ursula K. Le Guin
item.description: "Love doesn't just sit there, like a stone, it has to be made, like bread; remade all the time, made new." -- Ursula K. Le Guin
